The claim is based on a Congressional Bu: CBO) report that stated raising the minimum wage to $10.10 an hour would help lift over a million Americans out of poverty.
The CBO report estimated that raising th: 10.10 would increase the net income of those living at or below the federal poverty level by $5 billion, which could move approximately 900,000 people above the poverty threshold.
The claim made by the Democratic challen: Alison Lundergan Grimes, initially stated "a million Americans," but she corrected herself to say "over a million Americans out of poverty," which is close to the actual figure.
